content:
Extrachromosomal Circular DNA Detection

The nf-core/circdna pipeline identifies extrachromosomal circular DNA (ecDNA) from sequencing data. ecDNAs carry oncogene amplifications and are major drivers of cancer drug resistance and tumor evolution.

Why ecDNA Matters in Cancer

Extrachromosomal DNA (ecDNA) is found in ~50% of cancers and enables:

  • Oncogene Amplification: High copy numbers of cancer-driving genes (MYC, EGFR, MDM2)
  • Drug Resistance: Rapid adaptation to therapy through copy number changes
  • Tumor Heterogeneity: Unequal ecDNA distribution creates diversity
  • Poor Prognosis: Associated with aggressive cancers and treatment failure

Scientific Applications

  • Cancer Genomics: Identify ecDNA-driven oncogene amplifications
  • Drug Resistance: Study mechanisms of therapy resistance
  • Precision Oncology: Target ecDNA-amplified genes
  • Tumor Evolution: Track ecDNA dynamics during treatment

Pipeline Features

  • Detects circular DNA from WGS, ATAC-seq, or Circle-seq
  • Identifies amplified genes on ecDNA
  • Provides visualization of circular structures
  • Quality control and filtering

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet:

  • sample: Sample identifier
  • fastq_1: Forward reads
  • fastq_2: Reverse reads

Key Outputs

  • ecDNA Calls: Identified circular DNA elements
  • Amplified Genes: Genes on ecDNA
  • Visualizations: Circos plots of ecDNA structure

Perfect for: Cancer genomicists • Precision oncology • Drug resistance research • Tumor evolution studies
